intro: Lysionotus fengshanensis, commonly known as the Fengshan mountain bellflower, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions and prefers cool, moist environments. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and is often found in forested areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
